VII.ii.1.B.6.a
.
Certifying School Attendance With VA Form 21-8960-1
At least once each year, VA requires each beneficiary who receives additional benefits for a school child to certify the child is attending school and intends to continue doing so through the date school attendance is scheduled to end.  VA does this by requiring the beneficiary to
complete and return
VA Form 21-8960-1
,
Certification of School Attendance or Termination
,
or
provide the information the form requests to one of VA’s NCCs.
Important
:  If VA does not receive certification of school attendance, it may discontinue benefits payable to or for the child.
References
:  For more information on
processing
VA Form 21-8960-1
, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart ii, 1.B.6.d
, and
VA’s schedule for mailing
VA Form 21-8960-1
, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart ii, 1.B.6.b
.
